$comment: OSCAL Assessment Plan Model: JSON Schema

json-schema-directive.title: Schema Directive
json-schema-directive.description: A JSON Schema directive to bind a specific schema to its document instance.

oscal-ap-oscal-ap:assessment-plan.title: Security Assessment Plan (SAP)
oscal-ap-oscal-ap:assessment-plan.description: An assessment plan, such as those provided by a FedRAMP assessor.

uuid.title: Assessment Plan Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this assessment plan in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the assessment plan can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

local-definitions.title: Local Definitions
local-definitions.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

terms-and-conditions.title: Assessment Plan Terms and Conditions
terms-and-conditions.description: Used to define various terms and conditions under which an assessment, described by the plan, can be performed. Each child part defines a different type of term or condition.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:metadata.title: Document Metadata
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:metadata.description: Provides information about the containing document, and defines concepts that are shared across the document.

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

items.title: Revision History Entry
items.description: An entry in a sequential list of revisions to the containing document, expected to be in reverse chronological order (i.e. latest first).

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document revision, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

items.title: Role
items.description: Defines a function, which might be assigned to a party in a specific situation.

id.title: Role Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the role.

title.title: Role Title
title.description: A name given to the role, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short-name.title: Role Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the role.

description.title: Role Description
description.description: A summary of the role's purpose and associated responsibilities.

items.title: Location
items.description: A physical point of presence, which may be associated with people, organizations, or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

uuid.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique ID for the location, for reference.

title.title: Location Title
title.description: A name given to the location, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

items.title: Location URL
items.description: The uniform resource locator (URL) for a web site or other resource associated with the location.

items.title: Party
items.description: An organization or person, which may be associated with roles or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

uuid.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for the party.

type.title: Party Type
type.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

name.title: Party Name
name.description: The full name of the party. This is typically the legal name associated with the party.

short-name.title: Party Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the party.

items.title: Party External Identifier
items.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID).

scheme.title: External Identifier Schema
scheme.description: Indicates the type of external identifier.

items.title: Organizational Affiliation
items.description: A reference to another party by UUID, typically an organization, that this subject is associated with.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:location-uuid.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier Reference
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:location-uuid.description: Reference to a location by UUID.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:party-uuid.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier Reference
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:party-uuid.description: Reference to a party by UUID.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:role-id.title: Role Identifier Reference
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:role-id.description: Reference to a role by UUID.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:back-matter.title: Back matter
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:back-matter.description: A collection of resources that may be referenced from within the OSCAL document instance.

items.title: Resource
items.description: A resource associated with content in the containing document instance. A resource may be directly included in the document using base64 encoding or may point to one or more equivalent internet resources.

uuid.title: Resource Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for a resource.

title.title: Resource Title
title.description: An optional name given to the resource, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

description.title: Resource Description
description.description: An optional short summary of the resource used to indicate the purpose of the resource.

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: An optional citation consisting of end note text using structured markup.

items.title: Resource link
items.description: A URL-based pointer to an external resource with an optional hash for verification and change detection.

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL pointing to the referenced resource.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

base64.title: Base64
base64.description: A resource encoded using the Base64 alphabet defined by RFC 2045.

filename.title: File Name
filename.description: Name of the file before it was encoded as Base64 to be embedded in a resource. This is the name that will be assigned to the file when the file is decoded.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:property.title: Property
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:property.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

name.title: Property Name
name.description: A textual label, within a namespace, that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or quality of the property's containing object.

uuid.title: Property Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for a property.

ns.title: Property Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

value.title: Property Value
value.description: Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.

class.title: Property Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's name.

group.title: Property Group
group.description: An identifier for relating distinct sets of properties.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:link.title: Link
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:link.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to a resource.

rel.title: Link Relation Type
rel.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link's hypertext reference. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

resource-fragment.title: Resource Fragment
resource-fragment.description: In case where the href points to a back-matter/resource, this value will indicate the URI fragment to append to any rlink associated with the resource. This value MUST be URI encoded.

text.title: Link Text
text.description: A textual label to associate with the link, which may be used for presentation in a tool.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:responsible-part.title: Responsible Party
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:responsible-part.description: A reference to a set of persons and/or organizations that have responsibility for performing the referenced role in the context of the containing object.

role-id.title: Responsible Role
role-id.description: A reference to a role performed by a party.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:action.title: Action
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:action.description: An action applied by a role within a given party to the content.

uuid.title: Action Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined action elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions of the document.

date.title: Action Occurrence Date
date.description: The date and time when the action occurred.

type.title: Action Type
type.description: The type of action documented by the assembly, such as an approval.

system.title: Action Type System
system.description: Specifies the action type system used.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:responsible-role.title: Responsible Role
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:responsible-role.description: A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

role-id.title: Responsible Role ID
role-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to a role performed.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:hash.title: Hash
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:hash.description: A representation of a cryptographic digest generated over a resource using a specified hash algorithm.

algorithm.title: Hash algorithm
algorithm.description: The digest method by which a hash is derived.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:remarks.title: Remarks
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:published.title: Publication Timestamp
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:published.description: The date and time the document was last made available.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:last-modified.title: Last Modified Timestamp
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:last-modified.description: The date and time the document was last stored for later retrieval.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:version.title: Document Version
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:version.description: Used to distinguish a specific revision of an OSCAL document from other previous and future versions.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:oscal-version.title: OSCAL Version
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:oscal-version.description: The OSCAL model version the document was authored against and will conform to as valid.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:email-address.title: Email Address
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:email-address.description: An email address as defined by RFC 5322 Section 3.4.1.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:telephone-number.title: Telephone Number
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:telephone-number.description: A telephone service number as defined by ITU-T E.164.

type.title: type flag
type.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:address.title: Address
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:address.description: A postal address for the location.

city.title: City
city.description: City, town or geographical region for the mailing address.

state.title: State
state.description: State, province or analogous geographical region for a mailing address.

postal-code.title: Postal Code
postal-code.description: Postal or ZIP code for mailing address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the mailing address.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:addr-line.title: Address line
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:addr-line.description: A single line of an address.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:document-id.title: Document Identifier
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata:document-id.description: A document identifier qualified by an identifier scheme.

scheme.title: Document Identification Scheme
scheme.description: Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:import-.title: Import System Security Plan
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:import-.description: Used by the assessment plan and POA&M to import information about the system.

href.title: System Security Plan Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to the system security plan for the system being assessed.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:local-o.title: Assessment-Specific Control Objective
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:local-o.description: A local definition of a control objective for this assessment. Uses catalog syntax for control objective and assessment actions.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value. When referencing an externally defined control, the Control Identifier Reference must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

description.title: Objective Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this control objective.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.title: Assessment Method
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.description: A local definition of a control objective. Uses catalog syntax for control objective and assessment activities.

uuid.title: Assessment Method Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this assessment method elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the assessment method can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.title: Assessment Method Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this assessment method.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:activit.title: Activity
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:activit.description: Identifies an assessment or related process that can be performed. In the assessment plan, this is an intended activity which may be associated with an assessment task. In the assessment results, this an activity that was actually performed as part of an assessment.

uuid.title: Assessment Activity Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this assessment activity elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the activity can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Included Activity Title
title.description: The title for this included activity.

description.title: Included Activity Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this included activity.

items.title: Step
items.description: Identifies an individual step in a series of steps related to an activity, such as an assessment test or examination procedure.

uuid.title: Step Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this step elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the step (in a series of steps) can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Step Title
title.description: The title for this step.

description.title: Step Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this step.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:task.title: Task
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:task.description: Represents a scheduled event or milestone, which may be associated with a series of assessment actions.

uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this task elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the task can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Task Title
title.description: The title for this task.

description.title: Task Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this task.

timing.title: Event Timing
timing.description: The timing under which the task is intended to occur.

on-date.title: On Date Condition
on-date.description: The task is intended to occur on the specified date.

date.title: On Date Condition
date.description: The task must occur on the specified date.

within-date-range.title: On Date Range Condition
within-date-range.description: The task is intended to occur within the specified date range.

start.title: Start Date Condition
start.description: The task must occur on or after the specified date.

end.title: End Date Condition
end.description: The task must occur on or before the specified date.

at-frequency.title: Frequency Condition
at-frequency.description: The task is intended to occur at the specified frequency.

period.title: Period
period.description: The task must occur after the specified period has elapsed.

unit.title: Time Unit
unit.description: The unit of time for the period.

items.title: Task Dependency
items.description: Used to indicate that a task is dependent on another task.

task-uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier Reference
task-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a unique task.

items.title: Associated Activity
items.description: Identifies an individual activity to be performed as part of a task.

activity-uuid.title: Activity Universally Unique Identifier Reference
activity-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to an activity defined in the list of activities.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:reviewe.title: Reviewed Controls and Control Objectives
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:reviewe.description: Identifies the controls being assessed and their control objectives.

description.title: Control Objective Description
description.description: A human-readable description of control objectives.

items.title: Assessed Controls
items.description: Identifies the controls being assessed. In the assessment plan, these are the planned controls. In the assessment results, these are the actual controls, and reflects any changes from the plan.

description.title: Assessed Controls Description
description.description: A human-readable description of in-scope controls specified for assessment.

items.title: Referenced Control Objectives
items.description: Identifies the control objectives of the assessment. In the assessment plan, these are the planned objectives. In the assessment results, these are the assessed objectives, and reflects any changes from the plan.

description.title: Control Objectives Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this collection of control objectives.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:select-.title: Select Control
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:select-.description: Used to select a control for inclusion/exclusion based on one or more control identifiers. A set of statement identifiers can be used to target the inclusion/exclusion to only specific control statements providing more granularity over the specific statements that are within the asessment scope.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value. When referencing an externally defined control, the Control Identifier Reference must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

items.title: Include Specific Statements
items.description: Used to constrain the selection to only specificity identified statements.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:select-.title: Select Objective
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:select-.description: Used to select a control objective for inclusion/exclusion based on the control objective's identifier.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.description: Used when the assessment subjects will be determined as part of one or more other assessment activities. These assessment subjects will be recorded in the assessment results in the assessment log.

uuid.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier for a set of assessment subjects that will be identified by a task or an activity that is part of a task. The locally defined UUID of the assessment subject placeholder can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Description
description.description: A human-readable description of intent of this assessment subject placeholder.

items.title: Assessment Subject Source
items.description: Assessment subjects will be identified while conducting the referenced activity-instance.

task-uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier
task-uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference (in this or other OSCAL instances) an assessment activity to be performed as part of the event. The locally defined UUID of the task can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.title: Subject of Assessment
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.description: Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and locations. In the assessment plan, this identifies a planned assessment subject. In the assessment results this is an actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes from the plan. exactly what will be the focus of this assessment. Any subjects not identified in this way are out-of-scope.

type.title: Subject Type
type.description: Indicates the type of assessment subject, such as a component, inventory, item, location, or party represented by this selection statement.

description.title: Include Subjects Description
description.description: A human-readable description of the collection of subjects being included in this assessment.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:select-.title: Select Assessment Subject
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:select-.description: Identifies a set of assessment subjects to include/exclude by UUID.

subject-uuid.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference
subject-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

type.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference Type
type.description: Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the uuid-ref within a subject.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:subject.title: Identifies the Subject
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:subject.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to a resource. Use type to indicate whether the identified resource is a component, inventory item, location, user, or something else.

subject-uuid.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference
subject-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

type.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference Type
type.description: Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the uuid-ref within a subject.

title.title: Subject Reference Title
title.description: The title or name for the referenced subject.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.title: Assessment Assets
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.description: Identifies the assets used to perform this assessment, such as the assessment team, scanning tools, and assumptions.

items.title: Assessment Platform
items.description: Used to represent the toolset used to perform aspects of the assessment.

uuid.title: Assessment Platform Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this assessment platform elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the assessment platform can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Assessment Platform Title
title.description: The title or name for the assessment platform.

items.title: Uses Component
items.description: The set of components that are used by the assessment platform.

component-uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:finding.title: Objective Status
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:finding.description: Captures an assessor's conclusions regarding the degree to which an objective is satisfied.

type.title: Finding Target Type
type.description: Identifies the type of the target.

target-id.title: Finding Target Identifier Reference
target-id.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference for a specific target qualified by the type.

title.title: Objective Status Title
title.description: The title for this objective status.

description.title: Objective Status Description
description.description: A human-readable description of the assessor's conclusions regarding the degree to which an objective is satisfied.

status.title: Objective Status
status.description: A determination of if the objective is satisfied or not within a given system.

state.title: Objective Status State
state.description: An indication as to whether the objective is satisfied or not.

reason.title: Objective Status Reason
reason.description: The reason the objective was given it's status.

uuid.title: Finding Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this finding in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the finding can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Finding Title
title.description: The title for this finding.

description.title: Finding Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this finding.

implementation-statement-uuid.title: Implementation Statement UUID
implementation-statement-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to the implementation statement in the SSP to which this finding is related.

items.title: Related Observation
items.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

observation-uuid.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier Reference
observation-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to an observation defined in the list of observations.

items.title: Associated Risk
items.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced risks that were used to determine the finding.

risk-uuid.title: Risk Universally Unique Identifier Reference
risk-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a risk defined in the list of risks.

uuid.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this observation elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the observation can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imorted OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Observation Title
title.description: The title for this observation.

description.title: Observation Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this assessment observation.

items.title: Observation Method
items.description: Identifies how the observation was made.

items.title: Observation Type
items.description: Identifies the nature of the observation. More than one may be used to further qualify and enable filtering.

items.title: Relevant Evidence
items.description: Links this observation to relevant evidence.

href.title: Relevant Evidence Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to relevant evidence.

description.title: Relevant Evidence Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this evidence.

collected.title: Collected Field
collected.description: Date/time stamp identifying when the finding information was collected.

expires.title: Expires Field
expires.description: Date/time identifying when the finding information is out-of-date and no longer valid. Typically used with continuous assessment scenarios.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:origin.title: Origin
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:origin.description: Identifies the source of the finding, such as a tool, interviewed person, or activity.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:origin-.title: Originating Actor
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:origin-.description: The actor that produces an observation, a finding, or a risk. One or more actor type can be used to specify a person that is using a tool.

actor-uuid.title: Actor Universally Unique Identifier Reference
actor-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to the tool or person based on the associated type.

role-id.title: Actor Role
role-id.description: For a party, this can optionally be used to specify the role the actor was performing.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:related.title: Task Reference
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:related.description: Identifies an individual task for which the containing object is a consequence of.

task-uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier Reference
task-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a unique task.

identified-subject.title: Identified Subject
identified-subject.description: Used to detail assessment subjects that were identfied by this task.

subject-placeholder-uuid.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier Reference
subject-placeholder-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a unique assessment subject placeholder defined by this task.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:threat-.title: Threat ID
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:threat-.description: A pointer, by ID, to an externally-defined threat.

system.title: Threat Type Identification System
system.description: Specifies the source of the threat information.

href.title: Threat Information Resource Reference
href.description: An optional location for the threat data, from which this ID originates.

uuid.title: Risk Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this risk elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the risk can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Risk Title
title.description: The title for this risk.

description.title: Risk Description
description.description: A human-readable summary of the identified risk, to include a statement of how the risk impacts the system.

statement.title: Risk Statement
statement.description: An summary of impact for how the risk affects the system.

items.title: Mitigating Factor
items.description: Describes an existing mitigating factor that may affect the overall determination of the risk, with an optional link to an implementation statement in the SSP.

uuid.title: Mitigating Factor Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this mitigating factor elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the mitigating factor can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

implementation-uuid.title: Implementation UUID
implementation-uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this implementation statement elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instancess. The locally defined UUID of the implementation statement can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.title: Mitigating Factor Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this mitigating factor.

deadline.title: Risk Resolution Deadline
deadline.description: The date/time by which the risk must be resolved.

risk-log.title: Risk Log
risk-log.description: A log of all risk-related tasks taken.

items.title: Risk Log Entry
items.description: Identifies an individual risk response that occurred as part of managing an identified risk.

uuid.title: Risk Log Entry Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this risk log entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the risk log entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for this risk log entry.

description.title: Risk Task Description
description.description: A human-readable description of what was done regarding the risk.

start.title: Start
start.description: Identifies the start date and time of the event.

end.title: End
end.description: Identifies the end date and time of the event. If the event is a point in time, the start and end will be the same date and time.

items.title: Risk Response Reference
items.description: Identifies an individual risk response that this log entry is for.

response-uuid.title: Response Universally Unique Identifier Reference
response-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a unique risk response.

items.title: Related Observation
items.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

observation-uuid.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier Reference
observation-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to an observation defined in the list of observations.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:logged-.title: Logged By
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:logged-.description: Used to indicate who created a log entry in what role.

party-uuid.title: Party UUID Reference
party-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to the party who is making the log entry.

role-id.title: Actor Role
role-id.description: A point to the role-id of the role in which the party is making the log entry.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:risk-st.title: Risk Status
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:risk-st.description: Describes the status of the associated risk.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:charact.title: Characterization
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:charact.description: A collection of descriptive data about the containing object from a specific origin.

items.title: Facet
items.description: An individual characteristic that is part of a larger set produced by the same actor.

name.title: Facet Name
name.description: The name of the risk metric within the specified system.

system.title: Naming System
system.description: Specifies the naming system under which this risk metric is organized, which allows for the same names to be used in different systems controlled by different parties. This avoids the potential of a name clash.

value.title: Facet Value
value.description: Indicates the value of the facet.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:respons.title: Risk Response
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:respons.description: Describes either recommended or an actual plan for addressing the risk.

uuid.title: Remediation Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this remediation elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the risk response can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

lifecycle.title: Remediation Intent
lifecycle.description: Identifies whether this is a recommendation, such as from an assessor or tool, or an actual plan accepted by the system owner.

title.title: Response Title
title.description: The title for this response activity.

description.title: Response Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this response plan.

items.title: Required Asset
items.description: Identifies an asset required to achieve remediation.

uuid.title: Required Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this required asset elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the asset can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Title for Required Asset
title.description: The title for this required asset.

description.title: Description of Required Asset
description.description: A human-readable description of this required asset.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.title: Assessment Part
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common:assessm.description: A partition of an assessment plan or results or a child of another part.

uuid.title: Part Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this part elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the part can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an ported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

name.title: Part Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type.

ns.title: Part Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

class.title: Part Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the part's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple parts of the same control with the same name and ns.

title.title: Part Title
title.description: A name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

prose.title: Part Text
prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:part.title: Part
oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:part.description: An annotated, markup-based textual element of a control's or catalog group's definition, or a child of another part.

id.title: Part Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the part.

name.title: Part Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type, which exists in a value space qualified by the ns.

ns.title: Part Namespace
ns.description: An optional namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

class.title: Part Class
class.description: An optional textual providing a sub-type or characterization of the part's name, or a category to which the part belongs.

title.title: Part Title
title.description: An optional name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

prose.title: Part Text
prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:parameter.title: Parameter
oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:parameter.description: Parameters provide a mechanism for the dynamic assignment of value(s) in a control.

id.title: Parameter Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the parameter.

class.title: Parameter Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a characterization of the type, purpose, use or scope of the parameter.

depends-on.title: Depends on
depends-on.description: (deprecated) Another parameter invoking this one. This construct has been deprecated and should not be used.

label.title: Parameter Label
label.description: A short, placeholder name for the parameter, which can be used as a substitute for a value if no value is assigned.

usage.title: Parameter Usage Description
usage.description: Describes the purpose and use of a parameter.

oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:parameter-.title: Constraint
oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:parameter-.description: A formal or informal expression of a constraint or test.

description.title: Constraint Description
description.description: A textual summary of the constraint to be applied.

items.title: Constraint Test
items.description: A test expression which is expected to be evaluated by a tool.

expression.title: Constraint test
expression.description: A formal (executable) expression of a constraint.

oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:parameter-.title: Guideline
oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:parameter-.description: A prose statement that provides a recommendation for the use of a parameter.

prose.title: Guideline Text
prose.description: Prose permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:parameter-.title: Parameter Value
oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:parameter-.description: A parameter value or set of values.

how-many.title: Parameter Cardinality
how-many.description: Describes the number of selections that must occur. Without this setting, only one value should be assumed to be permitted.

items.title: Choice
items.description: A value selection among several such options.

oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:include-al.title: Include All
oscal-ap-oscal-control-common:include-al.description: Include all controls from the imported catalog or profile resources.

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:sys.title: Component
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:sys.description: A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

uuid.title: Component Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this component elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the component can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

type.title: Component Type
type.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

title.title: Component Title
title.description: A human readable name for the system component.

description.title: Component Description
description.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

status.title: Status
status.description: Describes the operational status of the system component.

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:pro.title: Service Protocol Information
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:pro.description: Information about the protocol used to provide a service.

uuid.title: Service Protocol Information Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this service protocol information elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the service protocol can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

name.title: Protocol Name
name.description: The common name of the protocol, which should be the appropriate "service name" from the IANA Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry.

title.title: Protocol Title
title.description: A human readable name for the protocol (e.g., Transport Layer Security).

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:por.title: Port Range
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:por.description: Where applicable this is the IPv4 port range on which the service operates.

start.title: Start
start.description: Indicates the starting port number in a port range

end.title: End
end.description: Indicates the ending port number in a port range

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:imp.title: Implementation Status
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:imp.description: Indicates the degree to which the a given control is implemented.

state.title: Implementation State
state.description: Identifies the implementation status of the control or control objective.

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:sys.title: System User
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:sys.description: A type of user that interacts with the system based on an associated role.

uuid.title: User Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this user class elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the system user can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: User Title
title.description: A name given to the user, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short-name.title: User Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the user.

description.title: User Description
description.description: A summary of the user's purpose within the system.

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:aut.title: Privilege
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:aut.description: Identifies a specific system privilege held by the user, along with an associated description and/or rationale for the privilege.

title.title: Privilege Title
title.description: A human readable name for the privilege.

description.title: Privilege Description
description.description: A summary of the privilege's purpose within the system.

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:fun.title: Functions Performed
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:fun.description: Describes a function performed for a given authorized privilege by this user class.

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:inv.title: Inventory Item
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:inv.description: A single managed inventory item within the system.

uuid.title: Inventory Item Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this inventory item elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the inventory item can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.title: Inventory Item Description
description.description: A summary of the inventory item stating its purpose within the system.

items.title: Implemented Component
items.description: The set of components that are implemented in a given system inventory item.

component-uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:set.title: Set Parameter Value
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:set.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

param-id.title: Parameter ID
param-id.description: A human-oriented reference to a parameter within a control, who's catalog has been imported into the current implementation context.

items.title: Parameter Value
items.description: A parameter value or set of values.

oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:sys.title: System Identification
oscal-ap-oscal-implementation-common:sys.description: A human-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this system identification property elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. When referencing an externally defined system identification, the system identification must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference). This string should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same system across revisions of the document.

identifier-type.title: Identification System Type
identifier-type.description: Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

Base64Datatype.description: Binary data encoded using the Base 64 encoding algorithm as defined by RFC4648.

DateTimeWithTimezoneDatatype.description: A string representing a point in time with a required timezone.

EmailAddressDatatype.description: An email address string formatted according to RFC 6531.

NonNegativeIntegerDatatype.description: An integer value that is equal to or greater than 0.

PositiveIntegerDatatype.description: An integer value that is greater than 0.

StringDatatype.description:
A non-empty string with leading and trailing whitespace disallowed. Whitespace is: U+9, U+10, U+32 or [ 
	]+

TokenDatatype.description: A non-colonized name as defined by XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition. https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-2/#NCName.

URIDatatype.description: A universal resource identifier (URI) formatted according to RFC3986.

URIReferenceDatatype.description: A URI Reference, either a URI or a relative-reference, formatted according to section 4.1 of RFC3986.

UUIDDatatype.description: A type 4 ('random' or 'pseudorandom') or type 5 UUID per RFC 4122.
